image.altText: Three women standing beside a medical bed with a fake person in it.

props.synopsis: Canberra Health System has reported an increase in the number of occupational violence incidents. But it's not all bad news.

title.children: Why Canberra hospitals are putting staff hobbies on the wall

image.altText: A hallway with carpet with rows of bikes.

props.synopsis: ACT Policing located the goods, estimated to be worth upwards of $50,000, in a serviced apartment.

title.children: AirTag helps uncover stolen stash of bikes and scooters in Canberra

image.altText: Garry Ringrosecelebrates with teammate Jamison Gibson-Park

props.synopsis: A full-strength British and Irish Lions have maintained their unbeaten run in Australia, with a 36-24 win over the ACT Brumbies.

title.children: Injury worries grow for Lions during win over resilient Brumbies

image.altText: Noah Papalii rubs his eye

props.synopsis: After Josh Papalii returns for one last glorious State of Origin hurrah, on a night when family means everything, his son Noah steals the show with a gorgeous, heartwarming moment.

title.children: Papalii's heroic Origin return capped by touching moment with son

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: The victim initially told police the offender "almost killed" her. But days later, the story had changed. A jury ultimately found the man had assaulted his partner.

title.children: Man guilty of assaulting partner despite victim withdrawing complaint

image.altText: A woman in a green blouse with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Police say a man was shot in the leg after two men in hoodies allegedly invaded his house during the night.

title.children: Police search for alleged home invaders after man shot in leg

image.altText: Oliver sits and smiles, holding his saxaphone.

props.synopsis: Plans to overhaul the 60-year-old ANU School of Music, including dropping one-on-one instrument lessons, have been met with shock and dismay by students and former staff.

title.children: 'Defies any logic': Staff, students react to ANU School of Music plan

image.altText: The stick protruding through Smooch's back.

props.synopsis: Smooch the cat's owners felt a golf-ball sized lump under her skin while giving their pet a cuddle. It saved her life.

title.children: Stick 17.5cm long found in cat's stomach with no entry or exit wound

image.altText: Tam Goddard

props.synopsis: Pet owners would be legally required to spend a minimum of three hours with their dog every day under the proposed laws, but questions remain about how such laws would be enforced.

title.children: Should the government tell you how long to spend with your dog?

image.altText: A young woman wears a baseball cap and a black jumper while carrying a skateboard

props.synopsis: A nationwide search is underway for a German backpacker who vanished in Western Australia's Wheatbelt, as police released more information about her movements in the lead up to her disappearance.

title.children: Backpacker mysteriously disappears in outback, sparking nationwide search

image.altText: A tight close-up of a white man with a beard and moustache - Zacahary Rolfe - with a stern expression, frowning.

props.synopsis: Former Northern Territory police officer Zachary Rolfe is considering an appeal of findings he was "racist" and ignored his training before fatally shooting an Aboriginal teenager in 2019.

title.children: Zachary Rolfe 'looking at' appeal in Yuendumu police shooting inquest

image.altText: Penny Wong stands at a lectern with an image of an Australian flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong promises South-East Asian nations that Australia will be a "reliable" partner with open markets, as the region grapples with the Trump administration's aid cuts and tariff threats.

title.children: Penny Wong promises Asian nations Australia will remain a 'reliable' partner

image.altText: A sketch of a young, dark-haired man in a shirt and tie.

props.synopsis: Jurors in the Victorian Supreme Court trial of Lachlan Young, who is accused of murdering Hannah McGuire in April 2024, have visited several locations allegedly linked to her death.

title.children: Jury visits house where Hannah McGuire was allegedly murdered

image.altText: Former NSW Police officers Nathan Black wearing black hoodies and black mask, left, and Timothy John Trautsch, right, in a suit

props.synopsis: One of the officers sent the footage of the incident involving the mentally ill woman to a colleague, saying: "The whole body worn is so good".

title.children: Ex-police officers plead guilty after kicking, pepper spraying naked woman

image.altText: Separate images of Don Gail and Heather on a coloured background with mushroom graphic in the corner

props.synopsis: The victims of Erin Patterson's deadly beef Wellington lunch are being remembered for their altruistic nature and kind hearts, just days after a jury convicted their killer of murder.

title.children: 'Model citizens' murdered by Erin Patterson leave legacy in Korumburra

image.altText: Two mushrooms on a leaf bed.

props.synopsis: Experts are weighing up whether to continue posting the locations of poisonous mushrooms on public databases like iNaturalist in the wake of the Erin Patterson trial.

title.children: Post mushroom trial, experts suggest changes to location sharing on iNaturalist

image.altText: divers looking at coral

props.synopsis: Australia has again been given a six-month warning to avoid the Great Barrier Reef being placed on the World Heritage Committee's "in danger" list, with the UN body warning its long-term outlook remains "very poor".

title.children: Six-month 'in danger' warning for Great Barrier Reef repeated at UN meeting

image.altText: Flames rise in Gaza

props.synopsis: The move comes after four days of indirect talks between Hamas and Israel, as the US signals its belief that an agreement for a 60-day truce will be struck before the end of the week.

title.children: Hamas agrees to release 10 hostages as part of Gaza ceasefire talks

image.altText: A woman blows her nose with a box of tissues in front of her

props.synopsis: Sometimes it's not easy to decipher when a sick child needs medical attention or just lots of hugs. Medical experts weigh in on the best way to manage symptoms and sickness this flu season

title.children: Experts reveal the best way to manage your child's flu symptoms

image.altText: A child whose face can't be seen sits on a small piece of climbing equipment in front of a coloured mat outdoors.

props.synopsis: As a nation we have been here before on catastrophic child safety failures and we will be here again unless the rhetoric is finally replaced by action.

title.children: Australia at 'turning point' for broken Working with Children checks

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market closed higher, despite the announcement of 50 per cent tariffs on copper being sold into the US from August 1. Meanwhile, the federal budget is within touching distance of a third straight surplus.

title.children: ASX closes higher despite Trump copper tariffs — as it happened

image.altText: A body of water in the middle of a gorge, with blue sky overhead.

props.synopsis: Police divers have located the body of a 57-year-old man after he slipped beneath the water while swimming at Edith Falls, near Katherine.

title.children: Police recover body of tourist from popular NT swimming spot

image.altText: Francesca Albanese holds one finger up while addressing the National Press Club

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has imposed sanctions on one of the UN's top advocates for Palestinian rights, Francesca Albanese, accusing her of "spewing unabashed antisemitism".

title.children: Trump administration sanctions UN human rights rapporteur

image.altText: Several explosions bursting out of the water around a large cargo ship.

props.synopsis: Iran-backed Houthi rebels have attacked and sunk a cargo ship travelling through the Red Sea, killing some crew members and leaving others adrift in the water.

title.children: Houthi rebels launch deadly attack on Red Sea cargo ship

image.altText: Cameron Munster closes his eyes on the field after a State of Origin game.

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster has enough legendary State of Origin performances to put him among the all-time greats, but this one felt like it was just for him, his family and his mates.

title.children: Amidst grief, Munster delivers iconic Origin after father's death

image.altText: Abhishek Shukla wears glasses as he sits in an empty room and takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: An Australian academic who made a film about the dark side of social media manipulation has been arrested by Indian police over allegations he fleeced a divorced woman.

title.children: Australian man accused of fleecing woman of $645k in alleged marriage scam

image.altText: Ralph Leroy Menzies during his competency hearing in November last year.

props.synopsis: The Utah man, who is convicted of murder, elected to be executed by firing squad in the 1980s.

title.children: How Utah laws have enabled a man with dementia to be executed by firing squad

image.altText: A Lamborghini the company purchased in January 2023 for $548,000.

props.synopsis: Six thousand First Guardian investors have been told by the fund's liquidator there may be insufficient funds to pay back the superannuation funds they invested.

title.children: First Guardian investors may never see their super, say liquidators

image.altText: CFMEU members surround AWU delegates

props.synopsis: Queensland's former Labor premier says he was not aware of threats made by CFMEU members to government ministers, after a report found the state branch used violence to further its agenda.

title.children: Labor leader says report into CFMEU branch 'deeply concerning'

image.altText: Linh Dao and David Tran pose behind their meal prep laid out on the kitchen bench.

props.synopsis: Does three hours of cooking every Sunday sound like an unbearable chore? Linh Dao and David Tran say it helps their whole week run smoothly and weeknights less frantic.

title.children: How three hours of meal prep saves this couple time, money and stress

image.altText: A man in a floral shirt lies in a hospital bed with an oxygen tube nestled on his large grey handlebar moustache.

props.synopsis: Former Rugby League front rower Sam Backo is in intensive care after contracting melioidosis, which has killed 34 Queenslanders so far this year.

title.children: Rugby league great battles deadly disease as cases surge

image.altText: A women wearing a swimming costume and cap is getting ready to swim.

props.synopsis: Paralympians have taken to social media to express their anger over separate Olympic and Paralympic swimming venues, at LA in 2028.

title.children: Paralympians express upset and disappointment over swimming venues for LA28

image.altText: Raynor Winn

props.synopsis: In the fake news era, what's the standard for truth in memoir?

title.children: Is bestselling memoir The Salt Path true and does it even matter?

image.altText: A picture of UTI test packaging laid out on a table.

props.synopsis: Urinary tract infections can be extremely painful but they're also very common. At-home tests are available to check if you have one — but how useful do experts say the tests really are?

title.children: How accurate and helpful are at-home UTI tests?

image.altText: A distant power plant with a smoke plume rising from its stacks

props.synopsis: Hunter Valley residents reported seeing plumes of smoke and smelling a strong diesel smell from the Kurri Kurri plant, prompting the company to halt testing at the site.

title.children: Snowy Hydro apologises for big stink from Hunter power plant
